title: How the Taliban takeover changed my life
description: From office workers to students, Afghans share how their lives have changed since August.

title: A lifetime with the Yanomami people of the Amazon
description: The photographer who spent 50 years fighting to protect indigenous people.

title: Alec Baldwin makes first public comments on 'one in a trillion' shooting
description: In his first public comments, the actor says the cinematographer he accidentally shot was his friend.

title: Tiny pumpkins a smash hit for Bristol glassmaker
description: Glassmaker Alice Evans says her tiny sculptures have been a hit, but they require a lot of focus.

title: Israeli woman jailed three times for refusing to join the army
description: Most Jewish Israelis do military service. But a small number, like Shahar, take an ideological stance.

title: The women reviving a vanishing legacy of Sufi music in Kashmir
description: This six-piece band has overcome a lot of opposition to be able to play Islamic devotional music.

title: Match of the Day: How 'awful' Spurs were 'perfect' for Man Utd after Liverpool thrashing
description: Match of the Day pundits Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Ian Wright discuss Tottenham's "awful" performance in their 3-0 defeat at home to Manchester United in the Premier League.

title: Does the UK have 'bigger fish to fry' in France row?
description: The prime minister says he does not want to increase hostilities with France over the fishing row.

title: England crush Australia as Buttler cuts loose
description: England outclassed Australia in a memorable eight-wicket victory in Dubai to close in on a place in the Men's T20 World Cup semi-finals.

title: Japan undersea volcano: Artist tries to swim in floating pumice stone
description: An eruption from an undersea volcano has coated the coastal waters off a Japanese island in pumice.

title: Faith groups and pilgrims lead Glasgow COP26 climate protests
description: Thousands of activists head to Glasgow to make their climate change concerns known.

title: Fishing row: Turbulence has hit relations with France, PM says
description: But Boris Johnson says more unites France and the UK than divides them, despite a row over fishing.

title: La Palma volcano survivors shaken but determined to rebuild
description: A vast lava flow reshapes a Canary Islands landscape, but does not crush the locals' hopes.

title: WBC champion Harper calls for changes to weight check rules for female boxers
description: WBC champion Terri Harper says she needs to carefully track her menstrual cycle during fight camp to make weight for title bouts - and believes governing bodies need to reform the rules.

title: Liverpool to host Leicester in Carabao Cup quarter-finals
description: Liverpool will take on Leicester in the Carabao Cup quarter-finals, while West Ham face Spurs, Arsenal host Sunderland and Chelsea go to Brentford.

title: G20: Climate and Covid top agenda as world leaders meet
description: The G20 leaders are holding their first face-to-face meeting since the start of the pandemic.

title: Whole country wishes Queen well - Boris Johnson
description: Boris Johnson says the Queen is "on good form" but it's important she follows doctors' advice to rest.

title: Ancient wooden Mayan canoe unearthed almost intact in Mexico
description: Archaeologists discovered the boat during construction work on a new tourist train network.

title: Black History Month: Boxer's family want colour bar apology
description: Cuthbert Taylor's Caribbean heritage meant he was barred from competing for the British title.

title: Australian cricket mourns loss of Davidson and Mallett
description: Australian cricket is mourning the loss of Test greats Alan Davidson and Ashley Mallett.

title: Tonga records first coronavirus case since start of pandemic
description: The island nation was one of the last countries in the world not to have reported any infections.

title: Manningtree wild swimmers stage River Stour sewage protest
description: The group are worried about the record amounts of raw sewage being pumped into waterways.

title: 'I'm proud to be a real-life witch'
description: Tonks Brown describes herself as a hedge witch and says Halloween is the biggest event in her calendar.

title: The Rolling Stones: Robot dog 'Spot' shares Mick Jagger's moves
description: A unique robotic version of Start Me Up celebrates 40 years since the release of The Rolling Stones' Tattoo You album.

title: Enniskillen: Children unearthing their town's forgotten streets
description: An archaeological dig in Enniskillen is unearthing parts of the "Backstreets" of Enniskillen.

title: Black History Month: Tony Collins - the first black manager in the English Football League
description: The undercelebrated story of the first black manager in the English Football League, who took Fourth Division Rochdale all the way to the 1962 League Cup final.

title: The Papers: 'Last chance' to save Earth, and UK 'must be punished'
description: The imminent COP26 climate talks in Glasgow feature prominently on Saturday's front pages.

title: Covid: Work train journeys fewer than half pre-pandemic
description: Commuting has increased since August, but is at significantly lower levels than two years ago.

title: Prince Andrew asks US court to dismiss case
description: The royal's lawyers argue Virginia Giuffre failed to sufficiently state her claims and is seeking a "payday".

title: Covid-19 origins may never be known, US intelligence agencies say
description: But US agencies say the virus, first identified in China, was not developed as a biological weapon.

title: Wales v New Zealand: Wayne Pivac's weakened side face weight of All Blacks history
description: Depleted Wales are being given little hope of breaking the 68-year losing hoodoo against New Zealand this weekend when the All Blacks arrive in Cardiff.

title: Facebook's metamorphosis - will it work?
description: Will Mark Zuckerberg's bet on a new name and the metaverse succeed?

title: T20 World Cup: The toxic trolling of India's cricket stars
description: As online abuse becomes the main form of venting, many worry about the toxicity cricketers face on social media.

title: How lifting Kenya's curfew may push revellers to get jabbed
description: Kenyans are loving their freedom as Covid restrictions ease, but vaccination rates are alarmingly low.
